name: The Forgotten Tunnels
description: A sprawling underground network of subway tunnels and stations, now overgrown with strange fungi and littered with abandoned trains. The air is thick with the smell of damp concrete and decay. Flickering emergency lights cast eerie shadows, and the distant sound of dripping water echoes through the tunnels. Survivors whisper of something moving in the deeper, unexplored sections.

points_of_interest.name: Central Station
points_of_interest.description: A once-bustling transit hub, now a maze of broken ticket booths and overturned benches. The main concourse is relatively clear, but the platforms are overrun.

points_of_interest.name: Maintenance Depot
points_of_interest.description: A workshop filled with rusted tools and broken machinery. Could still have usable parts if you're brave enough to dig through the wreckage.

points_of_interest.name: Supply Cache
points_of_interest.description: A hidden stash left by previous survivors, tucked away in an old employee break room. The door is barricaded from the inside.

points_of_interest.name: Collapsed Tunnel
points_of_interest.description: A section of the tunnel that has caved in, creating a dangerous bottleneck. Something seems to be moving in the rubble.

points_of_interest.name: Generator Room
points_of_interest.description: A small room housing backup generators. With some work, they might still provide power to parts of the station.

points_of_interest.name: The Glass Canopy
points_of_interest.description: A shattered glass dome that once regulated sunlight for plants, now a dangerous field of broken glass and hanging vines

points_of_interest.name: Fungal Grove
points_of_interest.description: A cluster of bioluminescent mushrooms that some survivors claim have medicinal properties

points_of_interest.name: Park Maintenance Shed
points_of_interest.description: A small storage building overtaken by roots, possibly containing old gardening tools and chemicals

districts.name: Overgrown Arboretum
districts.description: What was once a beautiful underground park has been reclaimed by nature after years of neglect. Vines and mutated plants burst through cracked concrete, creating a dangerous but resource-rich environment. The air smells damp and earthy, with occasional pockets of bioluminescent fungi providing eerie illumination. Survivors report hearing strange rustling in the overgrowth that doesn't sound quite human.
districts.faction_presence: The Green Thumbs - a group of survivalists who believe in coexisting with the mutated flora
special_features: mutated plants that react to movement
